sub_title: Senior Scientist Specialist at TNO | Plasma scientist | EUV lithography
summary: In March 2018 I have joined TNO, at the Nano-Instrumentation group where I continue my passion for applied physics. At my current position I work closely with our clients from ASML and Carl Zeiss to build a knowledge on EUV-generated hydrogen plasma, which is present inside of the latest generation of lithography tools. Our joined effort is to measure properties of that plasma, using mostly home-build metrology, reproduce the plasma in off-line setups and to simulate it with advanced models. Additionally I investigate the effect of this unique plasma on materials, which are used in EUV lithography tools, to predict their behavior and significantly improve their lifetime.

treasury_media.title: YER - Aneta Stodólna
treasury_media.description: My 1 min pitch on my research at TNO for a nomination to Young Excellent Researcher 2021.

treasury_media.title: What physicists do with light: Aneta Stodolna
treasury_media.description: In the FOM Annual Report 2014 physicists tell us about their research into light. You can read the interviews here (in Dutch): http://www.fom.nl/live/overfom/jaarverslagen/artikel.pag?objectnumber=292431&referpagina=14197 Who? Aneta Stodolna graduated from the Gdańsk University of Technology (Poland) and completed her PhD at FOM institute AMOLF.

authors.headline: Senior Scientist Specialist at TNO | Plasma scientist | EUV lithography

profile_positions.description: Deepening knowledge on EUV-generated hydrogen plasma. Development of metrology for measuring plasma properties with the focus on H radicals. Reproducing properties of EUV-generated plasma in off-line setups at TNO to reduce costs of accelerated life-time tests. Controlled experiments and measurements of the interaction between hydrogen plasma and materials.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist Specialist

profile_positions.description: Measuring properties of so-called EUV-generated hydrogen plasma. Mimicking properties of that unique plasma at TNO setups by means of commercial plasma sources (ECR) or home-build sources using an electron-beam. Measurements of H recombination rates for various materials used in EUV lithography tools.
profile_positions.title: Medior Scientist Specialist

profile_positions.description: The goal of the research is to understand the fundamental processes underlying the generation of EUV (extreme-ultraviolet) light from laser-generated plasmas. Especially, by employing advanced ultrafast laser systems providing energetic pulses in the range from EUV to the infrared we want to increase the efficiency of the light production at 13.5 nm.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

company.name: FOM Institute for Atomic and Molecular Physics

profile_positions.description: Designing and building experimental setups for photoionization microscopy that includes laser systems, atomic sources and particle detectors, simulations and data analysis, writing scientific publications.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral candidate (PhD)

profile_positions.description: Designing and building a new beam line for Collinear Resonant Ionization Spectroscopy (CRIS) at the ISOLDA hall at CERN.
profile_positions.title: Junior researcher
